alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains above 11000 Ft; Southern San Luis Valley; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Above 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:05PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Alamosa, southwestern Huerfano and northeastern Costilla Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 405 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Costilla county, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Costilla county, Indian Creek on the southeastern Spring Burn Scar, southwestern Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Huerfano county, western Spring Burn Scar north of Highway 160, Blanca, Fort Garland and Blanca Peak. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
